alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Gloucester; James City; Mathews; Middlesex; Surry; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gloucester, southeastern Middlesex, southeastern Charles City, northwestern York, Mathews, James City, and northeastern Surry Counties and the City of Williamsburg through 615 PM EDT... At 546 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jamestown, or near Claremont, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Jamestown around 550 PM EDT. Williamsburg, College Of William And Mary, Norge, Toano and Kings Point around 555 PM EDT. Queens Lake, York Terrace, Carver Gardens, Busch Gardens and Grove around 600 PM EDT. Gloucester Point and Wicomico around 610 PM EDT. Gloucester Courthouse and Hayes around 615 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Croaker, Beulah, Moon, Laban, Camp Peary, Naxera, Grafton, Amburg, Ewell and Allmondsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Gloucester; James City; Mathews; Middlesex; Surry; York
